title: Resources related to covered topics
text:
One section on published papers (or pre-prints) that present these different methods for animal movement analyses (i.e., further readings)
Another section on online resources for using each of the different R packages presented (i.e., package websites, vignettes)
Any other relevant miscellaneous resources

title: Space-use and behavioral state estimation from animal telemetry data
text:
A NSF-funded workshop by Josh Cullen

üìÜ ‚ÄÇSeptember 8 - 9, 2022
‚è∞ ‚ÄÇ9:00 am - 5:00 pm
üè´ ‚ÄÇFlorida State University, EOAS 3063

title: Space-use and behavioral state estimation from animal telemetry data
text:
Learning objectives

Gain experience in exploring many aspects of collected satellite telemetry data
Learn how to account for location error using state-space models
Learn how to implement advanced statistical models to estimate behavioral states
Learn how to implement a variety of methods to estimate space-use
Understand how to decide among different methods to estimate behavioral states and/or space-use depending on the study objectives and available data
Gain experience in generating plots to visualize model results and disseminate findings

title: Space-use and behavioral state estimation from animal telemetry data
section: Who is this workshop aimed at?
text:
Who is this workshop aimed at?

Advanced undergraduate students, graduate students, postdocs, and any other professionals that would like to learn more about the available options for study animal movement ecology
Intermediate to advanced R users
Practitioners familiar with animal telemetry data
Beginner to intermediate GIS users

title: How to prepare for this workshop
text: Provide explicit instructions that attendees should attempt to install all software at least 2 days before the workshop. That way I can help if they run into issues and can‚Äôt install or run some of the necessary R packages.

title: Troubleshooting computer problems
text: Point attendees towards relevant websites, primarily related to issues w/ compiler errors or TMB install.
